<span key="e8e78edb83d5401f9987ae485a4a9db1"><span offset-key="e8e78edb83d5401f9987ae485a4a9db1:0">01.test.js</span></span>

1

<span key="768ad38e4b6b4a08a1ae53f95ad1dcbd"><span offset-key="768ad38e4b6b4a08a1ae53f95ad1dcbd:0">$ npx jest 01</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7" />

Copied!

## 

<span key="b959cf5bfb8c418695aa09dd75b480ca"><span offset-key="b959cf5bfb8c418695aa09dd75b480ca:0">2. Transpile modules with babel in Jest tests</span></span>

<span key="7432b7d1bdd44d578c2ec4f573732cfd"><span offset-key="7432b7d1bdd44d578c2ec4f573732cfd:0">02.test.js</span></span>

1

<span key="cd2be935ee2c45f88730134f25d420e3"><span offset-key="cd2be935ee2c45f88730134f25d420e3:0">$ npx jest 02</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="2534c1654f7045d083aaf7180c4aabd8"><span offset-key="2534c1654f7045d083aaf7180c4aabd8:0">Setting </span>`@babel/preset-env.modules`<span offset-key="2534c1654f7045d083aaf7180c4aabd8:2"> to </span>`false`<span offset-key="2534c1654f7045d083aaf7180c4aabd8:4"> in </span>`.babelrc.js`<span offset-key="2534c1654f7045d083aaf7180c4aabd8:6"> prevents transpiling of our code, so that tools like webpack can use tree shaking before transpilation. For tests we want modules transformed so that we don't get ES6 errors.</span></span>

<span key="17be725cce2b488f8e175fe4a2286cf5"><span offset-key="17be725cce2b488f8e175fe4a2286cf5:0">We want our tests transpiled to commonjs before Jest evaluates them. In </span>`.babelrc.js`<span offset-key="17be725cce2b488f8e175fe4a2286cf5:2"> we can check if we are in the test environment; if so, we configure modules to </span>`commonjs`<span offset-key="17be725cce2b488f8e175fe4a2286cf5:4"> for </span>`@babel/preset-env`<span offset-key="17be725cce2b488f8e175fe4a2286cf5:6">, otherwise disable module transpilation entirely.</span></span>

<span key="a13dd679a0a04baf9ea8d55177b74d74"><span offset-key="a13dd679a0a04baf9ea8d55177b74d74:0">Jest automatically runs with </span>`NODE_ENV`<span offset-key="a13dd679a0a04baf9ea8d55177b74d74:2"> set to </span>`test`<span offset-key="a13dd679a0a04baf9ea8d55177b74d74:4">.</span></span>

<span key="d4eb5f2428da45a893444afd6f3f2083"><span offset-key="d4eb5f2428da45a893444afd6f3f2083:0">We didn't need to configure Jest at all. Jest picks up our </span>`babelrc.js`<span offset-key="d4eb5f2428da45a893444afd6f3f2083:2"> and uses that to run tests.</span></span>

## 

<span key="91f87f0f9e3444f389e749f6972f155e"><span offset-key="91f87f0f9e3444f389e749f6972f155e:0">3. Configure Jest’s test environment for testing node or browser code</span></span>

<span key="b156cffafe7c41f289ff804c385e5d9f"><span offset-key="b156cffafe7c41f289ff804c385e5d9f:0">03.test.js</span></span>

1

<span key="f8c17734d9bb447289d3aa1c26d6a3ed"><span offset-key="f8c17734d9bb447289d3aa1c26d6a3ed:0">$ npx jest 03</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="3b5d5c087b8d47fcb243e523f0880392"><span offset-key="3b5d5c087b8d47fcb243e523f0880392:0">Jest automatically requires </span>`jsdom`<span offset-key="3b5d5c087b8d47fcb243e523f0880392:2"> to make </span>`window`<span offset-key="3b5d5c087b8d47fcb243e523f0880392:4"> accessible in our tests. This is useful, but if we're in a Node environment, then we're taking a performance hit by loading a module that we likely don't need.</span></span>

<span key="5cc21dcecc2e425fb7431defcd13b95c"><span offset-key="5cc21dcecc2e425fb7431defcd13b95c:0">We can configure whether </span>`jsdom`<span offset-key="5cc21dcecc2e425fb7431defcd13b95c:2"> is loaded or not by making use of the </span>`testEnvironment`<span offset-key="5cc21dcecc2e425fb7431defcd13b95c:4"> property in </span>`jest.config.js`<span offset-key="5cc21dcecc2e425fb7431defcd13b95c:6">, or by running Jest with a flag:</span></span>

1

<span key="88f0b79b1652459b9bf63281764eda1d"><span offset-key="88f0b79b1652459b9bf63281764eda1d:0">$ npx jest 03 --env</span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="88f0b79b1652459b9bf63281764eda1d:1">=</span><span offset-key="88f0b79b1652459b9bf63281764eda1d:2">node</span></span>

2

<span key="9454509fcf0e40a4ac13e7cf3596b352"><span offset-key="9454509fcf0e40a4ac13e7cf3596b352:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

3

<span key="286edc2490844defbf4db10079bd46b3"><span class="r-17y197c" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="286edc2490844defbf4db10079bd46b3:0"># or</span></span>

4

<span key="28af01b8704442feaf1904e0f2cd3146"><span offset-key="28af01b8704442feaf1904e0f2cd3146:0">$ </span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="28af01b8704442feaf1904e0f2cd3146:1">npm</span><span offset-key="28af01b8704442feaf1904e0f2cd3146:2"> t -- --env</span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="28af01b8704442feaf1904e0f2cd3146:3">=</span><span offset-key="28af01b8704442feaf1904e0f2cd3146:4">node</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

## 

<span key="aa8ed053a6cb4358b6025f3bf8371e12"><span offset-key="aa8ed053a6cb4358b6025f3bf8371e12:0">4. Support importing CSS files with Jest’s moduleNameMapper</span></span>

<span key="fa5e76f5a9734d639eb2dc87f5f4a075"><span offset-key="fa5e76f5a9734d639eb2dc87f5f4a075:0">04.test.js</span></span>

1

<span key="7fae3ce453c34dec9be8394387f7b137"><span offset-key="7fae3ce453c34dec9be8394387f7b137:0">$ npx jest 04</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="701d9bdf805e40d292880a95fca73b5f"><span offset-key="701d9bdf805e40d292880a95fca73b5f:0">Importing </span>`.css`<span offset-key="701d9bdf805e40d292880a95fca73b5f:2"> and other asset files into Javascript files is non-standard JS, and one of the reasons behind using loaders in webpack.</span></span>

<span key="8a239441f3ea4fe0b0171a53806f9bcb"><span offset-key="8a239441f3ea4fe0b0171a53806f9bcb:0">When running our tests, Node knows nothing about the </span>`.css`<span offset-key="8a239441f3ea4fe0b0171a53806f9bcb:2"> import in </span>`auto-scaling-text.js`<span offset-key="8a239441f3ea4fe0b0171a53806f9bcb:4">, and simply expects it to be a node module, which it isn't.</span></span>

<span key="0279801caf604e83bdc0148efa14c505"><span offset-key="0279801caf604e83bdc0148efa14c505:0">To get around this, we can configure Jest to import files we specify using </span>`moduleNameMapper`<span offset-key="0279801caf604e83bdc0148efa14c505:2"> in </span>`jest.config.js`<span offset-key="0279801caf604e83bdc0148efa14c505:4">.</span></span>

<span key="773a81e5be474e9a8431b3cd953c13d3"><span offset-key="773a81e5be474e9a8431b3cd953c13d3:0">This can be usef for svg, graphql, or any other non-node module imports.</span></span>

## 

<span key="efe85b032fc240c5a9241b67491f904d"><span offset-key="efe85b032fc240c5a9241b67491f904d:0">5. Support using webpack CSS modules with Jest</span></span>

<span key="2205c400a8994a5e9a3c18f6b7c85de5"><span offset-key="2205c400a8994a5e9a3c18f6b7c85de5:0">05.test.js</span></span>

1

<span key="80b0bd366eca46abb4d6ca714dff7a7d"><span offset-key="80b0bd366eca46abb4d6ca714dff7a7d:0">$ npx jest 05</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="d80a664c2f864fe79f2ac3147854643d"><span offset-key="d80a664c2f864fe79f2ac3147854643d:0">CSS modules are converted into objects, but our initial styles mock in the Jest config returns an empty ojbect always, resulting in components importing the CSS as modules always having classNames of </span>`undefined`<span offset-key="d80a664c2f864fe79f2ac3147854643d:2">.</span></span>

<span key="0bc8fa676a204ab6969669908ed71016"><span offset-key="0bc8fa676a204ab6969669908ed71016:0">It'd be more valuable to have some indication that the CSS import is doing something. To do so, we can use </span>`identity-obj-proxy`<span offset-key="0bc8fa676a204ab6969669908ed71016:2"> which is specifically built to improve mocking of imports.</span></span>

<span key="270906f8eba84df9ae07198999a5b3f0">`moduleNameMapper`<span offset-key="270906f8eba84df9ae07198999a5b3f0:1"> is order-dependent, so we add a test to match for </span>`.module.css`<span offset-key="270906f8eba84df9ae07198999a5b3f0:3"> before </span>`.css`<span offset-key="270906f8eba84df9ae07198999a5b3f0:5">, which then results in </span>`identity-obj-proxy`<span offset-key="270906f8eba84df9ae07198999a5b3f0:7"> outputting a more meaningful class on our component which we can then test for.</span></span>

## 

<span key="f9ce6e98c6f64abf946b01a98947a662"><span offset-key="f9ce6e98c6f64abf946b01a98947a662:0">6. Generate a Serializable Value with Jest Snapshots</span></span>

<span key="25d9584f422543049e18715b68137775"><span offset-key="25d9584f422543049e18715b68137775:0">06.test.js</span></span>

1

<span key="48c2db4637f34b649eb76d095c9f5baf"><span offset-key="48c2db4637f34b649eb76d095c9f5baf:0">$ npx jest 06</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="f68707588c6b4083a8796bb5951bfcb3"><span offset-key="f68707588c6b4083a8796bb5951bfcb3:0">Jest's </span>`.toMatchSnapshot`<span offset-key="f68707588c6b4083a8796bb5951bfcb3:2"> serialises objects and evaluates changes to objects.</span></span>

<span key="60f61b18228f417db3eefeb7d1b2ce4f">`react-testing-library`<span offset-key="60f61b18228f417db3eefeb7d1b2ce4f:1">'s </span>`container`<span offset-key="60f61b18228f417db3eefeb7d1b2ce4f:3"> property on the return value of </span>`render`<span offset-key="60f61b18228f417db3eefeb7d1b2ce4f:5"> always wraps components in a div. If you want to evaluate your component exclusively, you should use </span>`container.firstChild`</span>

## 

<span key="f0250d37bb424ba4b1e0b7a262870e81"><span offset-key="f0250d37bb424ba4b1e0b7a262870e81:0">7. Test an Emotion Styled UI with Custom Jest Snapshot Serializers</span></span>

<span key="473da3e95aa54c12b7219018af63f4d0"><span offset-key="473da3e95aa54c12b7219018af63f4d0:0">07.test.js</span></span>

1

<span key="7867e18bf8624f87aa965b2caa731543"><span offset-key="7867e18bf8624f87aa965b2caa731543:0">$ npx jest 07</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="94a18b6ed9974665968bb581e512711e"><span offset-key="94a18b6ed9974665968bb581e512711e:0">The snapshot generated in the previous exercise is not too useful, as we're getting a generated classname from </span>`emotion`<span offset-key="94a18b6ed9974665968bb581e512711e:2">. When the CSS changes, we get a new classname, but we have no idea what that actually means.</span></span>

<span key="051430a25a554ab39189a05c4c5bddcc"><span offset-key="051430a25a554ab39189a05c4c5bddcc:0">Jest serialisers allow one to modify how different tests are serialized. In the case of </span>`emotion`<span offset-key="051430a25a554ab39189a05c4c5bddcc:2"> we can use </span>`jest-emotion`<span offset-key="051430a25a554ab39189a05c4c5bddcc:4">'s serializer to output the actual CSS in our snapshot, revealing the implication of the updated snapshot.</span></span>

<span key="f4f5f871acc64591ad9d297db6630e0b"><span offset-key="f4f5f871acc64591ad9d297db6630e0b:0">Other snapshot serializers, such as </span>`jest-serializer-path`<span offset-key="f4f5f871acc64591ad9d297db6630e0b:2">, can be used to modify snapshots. </span>`jest-serializer-path`<span offset-key="f4f5f871acc64591ad9d297db6630e0b:4"> normalises absolute paths to project root to prevent conflicts between different devs' systems.</span></span>

## 

<span key="1a13574e765d47f0a01fdaa409362928"><span offset-key="1a13574e765d47f0a01fdaa409362928:0">8. Handle Dynamic Imports using Babel with Jest</span></span>

<span key="2efc70092f0749ceb3d67a9537edaaef"><span offset-key="2efc70092f0749ceb3d67a9537edaaef:0">08.test.js</span></span>

1

<span key="419b90577c9846159886e896ea7f864c"><span offset-key="419b90577c9846159886e896ea7f864c:0">$ npx jest 08</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="02c8d817d3284d86aec22368dc79e9b3"><span offset-key="02c8d817d3284d86aec22368dc79e9b3:0">Dynamic imports are made possible in JS through webpack, but they are not a feature of Node. Because Node doesn't support dynamic imports, our tests are going to fail as soon as they come across any of them.</span></span>

<span key="93fb6385098e415b9f5b494780a024d5"><span offset-key="93fb6385098e415b9f5b494780a024d5:0">To resolve this we need to configure </span>`babel`<span offset-key="93fb6385098e415b9f5b494780a024d5:2"> to transform them. We only want this done when tests are run, as Webpack should be left responsible handling dynamic imports for dev and production.</span></span>

## 

<span key="5f21a5a8d37e49189a21987f17b36dc9"><span offset-key="5f21a5a8d37e49189a21987f17b36dc9:0">9. Setup an afterEach Test Hook for all tests with Jest setupTestFrameworkScriptFile</span></span>

<span key="b95a1da12b504c33936fde62afed0c25"><span offset-key="b95a1da12b504c33936fde62afed0c25:0">09.test.js</span></span>

1

<span key="e743caba46a545608794fe4d5b207957"><span offset-key="e743caba46a545608794fe4d5b207957:0">$ npx jest 09</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="15577b8806094518ab1b2ef566373c99"><span offset-key="15577b8806094518ab1b2ef566373c99:0">We have a lot of repetition in our tests, where we have the cleanup imported in each file, and we'd likely want to use the </span>`emotion`<span offset-key="15577b8806094518ab1b2ef566373c99:2"> serialiser in other components, too.</span></span>

<span key="cda0c70b7325412898ef3b59266511f7"><span offset-key="cda0c70b7325412898ef3b59266511f7:0">We can abstract the common code to a single file, and then import that into each file, but Jest has a more effective way to run code for all tests.</span></span>

<span key="e35730e039204e218fa474a37628ab2d"><span offset-key="e35730e039204e218fa474a37628ab2d:0">There are 2 ways to configure Jest to automatically import code into tests:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="63b4c80b7c764a38861fa6258686fce6">`setupFiles`<span offset-key="63b4c80b7c764a38861fa6258686fce6:1"> - this is an array of files that are run </span>*before Jest is loaded*<span offset-key="63b4c80b7c764a38861fa6258686fce6:3">. This is useful for anything that doesn't need Jest to be loaded.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="9effd83d73bc4469bab9315956c4a008">`setupTestFrameworkScriptFile`<span offset-key="9effd83d73bc4469bab9315956c4a008:1"> - a path to a file that we want run once Jest has loaded. This file is needed if we are going to do things like add snapshot serialisers, mocks, etc.</span></span>

## 

<span key="35c41702ee8441468dffd0a6700cef5c"><span offset-key="35c41702ee8441468dffd0a6700cef5c:0">10. Support custom module resolution with Jest moduleDirectories</span></span>

<span key="fe7acb6d41094469b0f91aaf0927e5c8"><span offset-key="fe7acb6d41094469b0f91aaf0927e5c8:0">10.test.js</span></span>

1

<span key="9b2adcda7a314fe494a0e602907aecb9"><span offset-key="9b2adcda7a314fe494a0e602907aecb9:0">$ npx jest </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="9b2adcda7a314fe494a0e602907aecb9:1">10</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="5e6f943e90664a86bb4ee35fe510d98d"><span offset-key="5e6f943e90664a86bb4ee35fe510d98d:0">In Webpack one can use the </span>`resolve.modules`<span offset-key="5e6f943e90664a86bb4ee35fe510d98d:2"> property to configure Webpack to evaluate paths in addition to </span>`node_modules`<span offset-key="5e6f943e90664a86bb4ee35fe510d98d:4"> to import modules. This is useful on large projects, and allows one to specify imports without incredibly long or tedious local import paths.</span></span>

<span key="a6a69163dcde43e69e620a014cfbba7f"><span offset-key="a6a69163dcde43e69e620a014cfbba7f:0">This, however, will not work in Jest by default, because a module import will fail if the file is actually found locally. An example of this is in </span>`calculator.js`<span offset-key="a6a69163dcde43e69e620a014cfbba7f:2"> where </span>`loadable`<span offset-key="a6a69163dcde43e69e620a014cfbba7f:4"> is being used to import </span>`calculator-display`<span offset-key="a6a69163dcde43e69e620a014cfbba7f:6"> dynamically, but as if it were a module.</span></span>

<span key="ef9a88e8cf354db7b7e31ab4cf377244"><span offset-key="ef9a88e8cf354db7b7e31ab4cf377244:0">To address this, one can use </span>`moduleDirectories`<span offset-key="ef9a88e8cf354db7b7e31ab4cf377244:2"> in the Jest config. </span>`moduleDirectories`<span offset-key="ef9a88e8cf354db7b7e31ab4cf377244:4"> is isomorphic to Webpack's </span>`resolve.modules`<span offset-key="ef9a88e8cf354db7b7e31ab4cf377244:6">, allowing module imports to resolve for local files.</span></span>

<span key="c8de0e97ecbd4fa8bd97d57957a509d0"><span offset-key="c8de0e97ecbd4fa8bd97d57957a509d0:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

<span key="a5757e3d18914cfe8f961e97701e6cfc">`loadable`<span offset-key="a5757e3d18914cfe8f961e97701e6cfc:1"> has a </span>`preloadAll`<span offset-key="a5757e3d18914cfe8f961e97701e6cfc:3"> method which can be used in async tests to load all dynamic modules. Without preloading the dynamic imports our components with dynamic imports will output the loading content.</span></span>

<span key="65cbcf70be6747a4a93e8096bd7c1d33"><span offset-key="65cbcf70be6747a4a93e8096bd7c1d33:0">We can use </span>`react-testing-library`<span offset-key="65cbcf70be6747a4a93e8096bd7c1d33:2">s </span>`debug`<span offset-key="65cbcf70be6747a4a93e8096bd7c1d33:4"> method that </span>`render`<span offset-key="65cbcf70be6747a4a93e8096bd7c1d33:6"> returns to evaluate the </span>`container`<span offset-key="65cbcf70be6747a4a93e8096bd7c1d33:8"> that render also returns.</span></span>

## 

<span key="25cf3c10b1eb4a60b3f77b1f76f54dbf"><span offset-key="25cf3c10b1eb4a60b3f77b1f76f54dbf:0">11. Support a test utilities file with Jest moduleDirectories</span></span>

<span key="74a34367f34b495a86e7b3b23bf8d2b6"><span offset-key="74a34367f34b495a86e7b3b23bf8d2b6:0">11.test.js</span></span>

1

<span key="00e7062479244b9d94fe9ba9cad2ea46"><span offset-key="00e7062479244b9d94fe9ba9cad2ea46:0">$ npx jest </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="00e7062479244b9d94fe9ba9cad2ea46:1">11</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="72fe5524b6614afc80329160a35e9be4"><span offset-key="72fe5524b6614afc80329160a35e9be4:0">For components that are wrapped in Consumers to get data we need to wrap them in Providers in our tests.</span></span>

<span key="5591ae4caa624d839075de8063994523"><span offset-key="5591ae4caa624d839075de8063994523:0">We can abstract the repetitive wrapping to its own function, and to its own file that can be imported into the relevant tests.</span></span>

<span key="d691718f21074739a0f6ee470e0342f6"><span offset-key="d691718f21074739a0f6ee470e0342f6:0">Furthermore, we can make the test utility file accessible by adding the path containing the utility to Jest's </span>`moduleDirectories`<span offset-key="d691718f21074739a0f6ee470e0342f6:2">, making it easier to access the utility.</span></span>

<span key="4bd8086090e54251be7125247f459633"><span offset-key="4bd8086090e54251be7125247f459633:0">On top of that, we can export all of </span>`react-testing-library`<span offset-key="4bd8086090e54251be7125247f459633:2"> from that file, mititigating the need to import both the utility and </span>`react-testing-library`<span offset-key="4bd8086090e54251be7125247f459633:4"> into our test, and can override </span>`react-testing-library`<span offset-key="4bd8086090e54251be7125247f459633:6">s </span>`render`<span offset-key="4bd8086090e54251be7125247f459633:8"> function so that our tests look the same, while benefitting from being wrapped in Providers automatically.</span></span>

<span key="75767c31c98a4674b6ff18407fc07be0"><span offset-key="75767c31c98a4674b6ff18407fc07be0:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

<span key="979f4c5166574868a5887e44ccc95428"><span offset-key="979f4c5166574868a5887e44ccc95428:0">Using Jest's </span>`moduleDirectories`<span offset-key="979f4c5166574868a5887e44ccc95428:2"> will result in eslint not being able to lint files, and catch errors like typos in imports.</span></span>

<span key="24393d422c9940d2b3d6404f26842597"><span offset-key="24393d422c9940d2b3d6404f26842597:0">To fix this we can add a resolver for eslint:</span></span>

1

<span key="a47c4d0149a54a4d9b3cb3776dfeae82"><span offset-key="a47c4d0149a54a4d9b3cb3776dfeae82:0">$ </span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="a47c4d0149a54a4d9b3cb3776dfeae82:1">npm</span><span offset-key="a47c4d0149a54a4d9b3cb3776dfeae82:2"> i -D eslint-import-resolver-jest</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="9a091e1198bf4356a807f46dc2843471"><span offset-key="9a091e1198bf4356a807f46dc2843471:0">In our eslint config we can now add an override to allow eslint to properly evaluate imports using our Jest config:</span></span>

1

<span key="b6d601642f0b4e2797577402388bad00"><span class="r-17y197c" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="b6d601642f0b4e2797577402388bad00:0">// eslintrc.js</span></span>

3

<span key="424cfa11f3d04404af1403b7f5523363"><span offset-key="424cfa11f3d04404af1403b7f5523363:0"> overrides</span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="424cfa11f3d04404af1403b7f5523363:1">:</span><span offset-key="424cfa11f3d04404af1403b7f5523363:2"> </span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="424cfa11f3d04404af1403b7f5523363:3">\[</span></span>

<span key="93f6bfdfdfc242a18e8cfc3dd798d3dd"><span offset-key="93f6bfdfdfc242a18e8cfc3dd798d3dd:0"> </span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="93f6bfdfdfc242a18e8cfc3dd798d3dd:1">\],</span></span>

15

<span key="d1900b33d6c24d2996d17a0b6a92ba40"><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="d1900b33d6c24d2996d17a0b6a92ba40:0">...</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="00a7e694de0243fcb5c001641e9fd3b1"><span offset-key="00a7e694de0243fcb5c001641e9fd3b1:0">eslint then uses Jest's </span>`moduleDirectories`<span offset-key="00a7e694de0243fcb5c001641e9fd3b1:2"> to resolve modules</span></span>

## 

<span key="634057052ef7409aa1eaa3505b6a59cb"><span offset-key="634057052ef7409aa1eaa3505b6a59cb:0">12. Step through Code in Jest using the Node.js Debugger and Chrome DevTools</span></span>

<span key="fc553363fd7e45e2b3ff7c036d52134a"><span offset-key="fc553363fd7e45e2b3ff7c036d52134a:0">Jest runs tests in parallel by default. We can instruct Jest to in a single thread using the </span>`--runInBand`<span offset-key="fc553363fd7e45e2b3ff7c036d52134a:2"> flag to speed up debugging.</span></span>

## 

<span key="f77f839a426c4eda8cf3b204bb93ae24"><span offset-key="f77f839a426c4eda8cf3b204bb93ae24:0">13. Configure Jest to report code coverage on project files</span></span>

1

<span key="7fd9e2822a104e43883f9ca1a08b05d5"><span offset-key="7fd9e2822a104e43883f9ca1a08b05d5:0">$ npx jest --coverage</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="3eef5e087c4a49feb08c8ee3d3b2adf9"><span offset-key="3eef5e087c4a49feb08c8ee3d3b2adf9:0">Running coverage indicates how much of your codebase has had tests written for it.</span></span>

<span key="a7a55b1192154d3e9c5c6ece7d0d5f76"><span offset-key="a7a55b1192154d3e9c5c6ece7d0d5f76:0">Jest generates coverage files in a </span>`coverage`<span offset-key="a7a55b1192154d3e9c5c6ece7d0d5f76:2"> folder, which should not be committed to the project.</span></span>

<span key="f0f9d41a7606475baf1424ffdd756648"><span offset-key="f0f9d41a7606475baf1424ffdd756648:0">Running the generated files with a server will allow one to inspect exactly where coverage is required:</span></span>

1

<span key="ae4f1031639249ac88931d36fabc333c"><span offset-key="ae4f1031639249ac88931d36fabc333c:0">$ npx jest --coverage </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="ae4f1031639249ac88931d36fabc333c:1">&&</span><span offset-key="ae4f1031639249ac88931d36fabc333c:2"> </span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="ae4f1031639249ac88931d36fabc333c:3">cd</span><span offset-key="ae4f1031639249ac88931d36fabc333c:4"> coverage/lcov-report </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="ae4f1031639249ac88931d36fabc333c:5">&&</span><span offset-key="ae4f1031639249ac88931d36fabc333c:6"> npx serve</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="e50ee5008b514c5dbc41094fb5b30d25"><span offset-key="e50ee5008b514c5dbc41094fb5b30d25:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

<span key="a4acf7223e024c99a3b1f1a260b69bd6"><span offset-key="a4acf7223e024c99a3b1f1a260b69bd6:0">Be default Jest will run coverage only for files included in our tests, and including tests.</span></span>

<span key="db9a8945c62b4271a8c9b24d38c33f94"><span offset-key="db9a8945c62b4271a8c9b24d38c33f94:0">We don't want to know coverage for our tests, so we can configure Jest to collect coverage only from specific files, using </span>`collectCoverageFrom`<span offset-key="db9a8945c62b4271a8c9b24d38c33f94:2"> in </span>`jest.config.js`<span offset-key="db9a8945c62b4271a8c9b24d38c33f94:4">, passing an array of paths that should be evaluated for coverage.</span></span>

<span key="7f4a787388d7492e9eb4e3521361da73">`collectCoverageFrom`<span offset-key="7f4a787388d7492e9eb4e3521361da73:1"> also indicates to Jest to include everything that may not even have a test file.</span></span>

## 

<span key="f47a8c1a39b040f090be40462b4ac50b"><span offset-key="f47a8c1a39b040f090be40462b4ac50b:0">14. Analyze Jest Code Coverage Reports</span></span>

<span key="5f77ab6a59f041b8befee48dfa399029"><span offset-key="5f77ab6a59f041b8befee48dfa399029:0">Jest uses Istanbul for generating coverage.</span></span>

## 

<span key="a29665fb52d14f68a6f04150b4dd41a0"><span offset-key="a29665fb52d14f68a6f04150b4dd41a0:0">15. Set a code coverage threshold in Jest to maintain code coverage levels</span></span>

1

<span key="7f2545c7ac7a4f4586039fa9c62f8c92"><span offset-key="7f2545c7ac7a4f4586039fa9c62f8c92:0">$ npx jest --coverage</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="544bb7d591a94bfbb3629dbf5f25ba2e"><span offset-key="544bb7d591a94bfbb3629dbf5f25ba2e:0">We can ocnfigure Jest to enforce code coverage levels. This is useful in CI to prevent builds / deployments if code coverage begins to suffer.</span></span>

<span key="fd89e641df5a47f782d11172f6e866e5"><span offset-key="fd89e641df5a47f782d11172f6e866e5:0">In Jest's config we use the </span>`coverageThreshold`<span offset-key="fd89e641df5a47f782d11172f6e866e5:2"> property to configure our thresholds.</span></span>

<span key="2007b41af9084862ae170eecf9072ed4"><span offset-key="2007b41af9084862ae170eecf9072ed4:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

<span key="31397842b4d74acd873d859407746a03"><span offset-key="31397842b4d74acd873d859407746a03:0">Not all lines are as valuable to have coverage for as others. To address this we can add globs as properties to the </span>`coverageThreshold`<span offset-key="31397842b4d74acd873d859407746a03:2"> property with fine-grained thresholds.</span></span>

## 

<span key="84126760ddd9458ea79678c0194cea53"><span offset-key="84126760ddd9458ea79678c0194cea53:0">16. Report Jest Test Coverage to Codecov through TavisCI</span></span>

<span key="4adda11f54ab48e187e544eaf8d2e761"><span offset-key="4adda11f54ab48e187e544eaf8d2e761:0">Using </span>`npx`<span offset-key="4adda11f54ab48e187e544eaf8d2e761:2"> we can run the </span>`codecov`<span offset-key="4adda11f54ab48e187e544eaf8d2e761:4"> binary to send code coverage reports to codecov.io</span></span>

<span key="98ea6b5b81314a44866ed4c8dd841936"><span offset-key="98ea6b5b81314a44866ed4c8dd841936:0">In </span>`.travis.yml`<span offset-key="98ea6b5b81314a44866ed4c8dd841936:2"> we can use the </span>`after_script`<span offset-key="98ea6b5b81314a44866ed4c8dd841936:4"> property to instruct Travis what to do once tests pass. This is when we'd want to run the </span>`codecov`<span offset-key="98ea6b5b81314a44866ed4c8dd841936:6"> binary.</span></span>

## 

<span key="a6fb87a01af942e3b49f2634680a29e4"><span offset-key="a6fb87a01af942e3b49f2634680a29e4:0">17. Use Jest Watch Mode to speed up development</span></span>

<span key="4ec226204c144c409c407fbcc6f4381e"><span offset-key="4ec226204c144c409c407fbcc6f4381e:0">Jest's </span>`--watch`<span offset-key="4ec226204c144c409c407fbcc6f4381e:2"> mode watches files for changes, and puts tests into interactive mode.</span></span>

<span key="554508b9aa9d46f1acb43868ff80f13e"><span offset-key="554508b9aa9d46f1acb43868ff80f13e:0">Jest watches for files that have been modified in Git, and runs tests against changed files.</span></span>

<span key="58f46a844eac471eab577d91a1d6359c"><span offset-key="58f46a844eac471eab577d91a1d6359c:0">Interactive mode commands:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="7704ca009bab4a669bd6bcb067feecd7">`u`<span offset-key="7704ca009bab4a669bd6bcb067feecd7:1"> update all failed snapshots</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="d4dcb655db7040c284181803897fbd04">`i`<span offset-key="d4dcb655db7040c284181803897fbd04:1"> interactively update failed snapshots</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

        <span key="752b1b4a95c14a1380c76b89c1019e6a">`u`<span offset-key="752b1b4a95c14a1380c76b89c1019e6a:1"> update the current snapshot</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

        <span key="23b68fbc91104a24ae9cc99c2c308d53">`s`<span offset-key="23b68fbc91104a24ae9cc99c2c308d53:1"> skip the current snapshot</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

        <span key="e26e714cdd0f43c4bbcf7688a8f425ef">`q`<span offset-key="e26e714cdd0f43c4bbcf7688a8f425ef:1"> quit interactive snapshot updating</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="046842ce5c7547b7b02cc9d173764381">`f`<span offset-key="046842ce5c7547b7b02cc9d173764381:1"> run only failing tests</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="799e383ab9254592a31b8ebe5f0a6e5a">`a`<span offset-key="799e383ab9254592a31b8ebe5f0a6e5a:1"> run all tests</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="4589cfe4a2f747c7afdc99dc3a64457a">`o`<span offset-key="4589cfe4a2f747c7afdc99dc3a64457a:1"> run tests only for files that are modified</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="4e900995dd5343f48a4bf39b26da703b">`p`<span offset-key="4e900995dd5343f48a4bf39b26da703b:1"> filter by filename regex pattern</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

        <span key="a0b2723d813a41f09e64c9d25965305d">`c`<span offset-key="a0b2723d813a41f09e64c9d25965305d:1"> clear filters</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="90ac20db342c41a695c28a6c70df491c">`t`<span offset-key="90ac20db342c41a695c28a6c70df491c:1"> filter by test name regex pattern. This behaves in a similar way to using </span>`test.only`<span offset-key="90ac20db342c41a695c28a6c70df491c:3"> to run only specified tests</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="7cf19ee9307546fb927b06b89559a626">`Enter`<span offset-key="7cf19ee9307546fb927b06b89559a626:1"> rerun the current tests</span></span>

## 

<span key="4de8c17d551845389beb37c427b64be8"><span offset-key="4de8c17d551845389beb37c427b64be8:0">18. Run Jest Watch Mode by default locally with is-ci-cli</span></span>

<span key="2fe88ca932924fde9b7ff322f5124494"><span offset-key="2fe88ca932924fde9b7ff322f5124494:0">Instead of running </span>`nom run test:watch`<span offset-key="2fe88ca932924fde9b7ff322f5124494:2"> locally and </span>`npm test`<span offset-key="2fe88ca932924fde9b7ff322f5124494:4"> on CI, we can use </span>`is-ci-cli`<span offset-key="2fe88ca932924fde9b7ff322f5124494:6"> to run one script or another, based on whether we are in a CI environment or not:</span></span>

1

<span key="fd002ee51ba34e49a3e59cfee569b179"><span offset-key="fd002ee51ba34e49a3e59cfee569b179:0">...</span></span>

2

<span key="0d00db91926e4e0da384d28980bbea6c"><span class="r-qtrn9a" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="0d00db91926e4e0da384d28980bbea6c:0">"scripts"</span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="0d00db91926e4e0da384d28980bbea6c:1">:</span><span offset-key="0d00db91926e4e0da384d28980bbea6c:2"> </span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="0d00db91926e4e0da384d28980bbea6c:3">{</span></span>

3

<span key="ff9b55a733b746dfbfeb893c475b52d1"><span offset-key="ff9b55a733b746dfbfeb893c475b52d1:0"> </span><span class="r-qtrn9a" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="ff9b55a733b746dfbfeb893c475b52d1:1">"my-script"</span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="ff9b55a733b746dfbfeb893c475b52d1:2">:</span><span offset-key="ff9b55a733b746dfbfeb893c475b52d1:3"> </span><span class="r-qtrn9a" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="ff9b55a733b746dfbfeb893c475b52d1:4">"is-ci 'my-ci-script' 'my-local-script'"</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="ff9b55a733b746dfbfeb893c475b52d1:5">,</span></span>

<span key="b0bcc05436f549718891253058e4f406"><span offset-key="b0bcc05436f549718891253058e4f406:0"> </span><span class="r-qtrn9a" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="b0bcc05436f549718891253058e4f406:1">"my-local-script"</span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="b0bcc05436f549718891253058e4f406:2">:</span><span offset-key="b0bcc05436f549718891253058e4f406:3"> ...</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="b0bcc05436f549718891253058e4f406:4">,</span></span>

## 

<span key="cfa627d500e44fd194f2f8c5ab565df0"><span offset-key="cfa627d500e44fd194f2f8c5ab565df0:0">19. Filter which Tests are Run with Typeahead Support in Jest Watch Mode</span></span>

<span key="430b30aec8894c418ed07cae741b9be2"><span offset-key="430b30aec8894c418ed07cae741b9be2:0">Being able to use </span>`p`<span offset-key="430b30aec8894c418ed07cae741b9be2:2"> and </span>`t`<span offset-key="430b30aec8894c418ed07cae741b9be2:4"> in Jest's </span>`watch`<span offset-key="430b30aec8894c418ed07cae741b9be2:6"> mode is useful, but we can get even better feedback using </span>`jest-watch-typeahead`<span offset-key="430b30aec8894c418ed07cae741b9be2:8">.</span></span>

<span key="2e75d7ba93d64ee1971c06d1e1b9bd2e">`jest-watch-typeahead`<span offset-key="2e75d7ba93d64ee1971c06d1e1b9bd2e:1"> is a plugin for </span>`watch`<span offset-key="2e75d7ba93d64ee1971c06d1e1b9bd2e:3"> which can be installed and then configured under the </span>`watchPlugins`<span offset-key="2e75d7ba93d64ee1971c06d1e1b9bd2e:5"> entry in </span>`jest.config.js`</span>

## 

<span key="7f2b4b888ef04bbbb64841945d9d3c4e"><span offset-key="7f2b4b888ef04bbbb64841945d9d3c4e:0">20. Run tests with a different configuration using Jest’s </span>`--config`<span offset-key="7f2b4b888ef04bbbb64841945d9d3c4e:2"> flag and testMatch option</span></span>

<span key="ab59844825dc4cf987c9ffcf9b06e9bf"><span offset-key="ab59844825dc4cf987c9ffcf9b06e9bf:0">Jest allows one to run specific configs using its </span>`--config`<span offset-key="ab59844825dc4cf987c9ffcf9b06e9bf:2"> flag. This allows us to easily run separate configs for client-side and server-side code.</span></span>

<span key="9ffcf13222b34acc8d3a8f8c15319bda"><span offset-key="9ffcf13222b34acc8d3a8f8c15319bda:0">By default Jest uses the config directory as the root directory to find tests to run.</span></span>

<span key="7baacf6f9bfb433b90fb7fcc011d5cfd"><span offset-key="7baacf6f9bfb433b90fb7fcc011d5cfd:0">Because we've now moved our configs to a subfolder Jest will no longer be able to find test files. To address this Jest allows for a </span>`rootDir`<span offset-key="7baacf6f9bfb433b90fb7fcc011d5cfd:2"> prop to be set in configs, which it will use as the root.</span></span>

## 

<span key="0f93af1163934ab18114a5939303ad31"><span offset-key="0f93af1163934ab18114a5939303ad31:0">21. Support Running Multiple Configurations with Jest’s Projects Feature</span></span>

<span key="48d5dedc37cd4d3fa37fae32abdd1109"><span offset-key="48d5dedc37cd4d3fa37fae32abdd1109:0">Jest allows multiple configurations to be run at the same time:</span></span>

1

<span key="6ef8a1d41d2545fb89d1aff729c18041"><span offset-key="6ef8a1d41d2545fb89d1aff729c18041:0">$ npx jest --projects test/jest.client.js test/jest.server.js</span></span>

2

<span key="ee8d1ff35d2d46e4ab388760f41a5e10"><span offset-key="ee8d1ff35d2d46e4ab388760f41a5e10:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

3

<span key="f8f6360cbf824312b139464e4f629faa"><span class="r-17y197c" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="f8f6360cbf824312b139464e4f629faa:0"># or</span></span>

4

<span key="25b627417b7945f5a213f185869dbd12"><span offset-key="25b627417b7945f5a213f185869dbd12:0">$ npx jest --projects test/jest.client.js test/jest.server.js --watch</span></span>

5

<span key="a70c49f780c942959dd0680abd4beb3d"><span offset-key="a70c49f780c942959dd0680abd4beb3d:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

6

<span key="db7844119ce448fa9535fa8206e415ac"><span class="r-17y197c" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="db7844119ce448fa9535fa8206e415ac:0"># or</span></span>

7

<span key="69d31bef5425498f9f840a3e354a65fd"><span offset-key="69d31bef5425498f9f840a3e354a65fd:0">$ npx jest --projects test/jest.client.js test/jest.server.js --coverage</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="97c54fb17fad4e97b14f299a88681939"><span offset-key="97c54fb17fad4e97b14f299a88681939:0">This allows one to eliminate the large number of test scripts building up in </span>`package.json`<span offset-key="97c54fb17fad4e97b14f299a88681939:2">.</span></span>

<span key="5331390a5cb249b2ba4d08b1fb9c44d8"><span offset-key="5331390a5cb249b2ba4d08b1fb9c44d8:0">Jest's </span>`projects`<span offset-key="5331390a5cb249b2ba4d08b1fb9c44d8:2"> property in the config accepts an array of configs to run at the same time.</span></span>

<span key="defdb80d797c4ca2a9da1aa7609d2a48"><span offset-key="defdb80d797c4ca2a9da1aa7609d2a48:0">To view a specific config in its entirety, one can run Jest with the </span>`--showConfig`<span offset-key="defdb80d797c4ca2a9da1aa7609d2a48:2"> flag:</span></span>

1

<span key="f4aca88418224226a6b09bef005fe61c"><span offset-key="f4aca88418224226a6b09bef005fe61c:0">$ npx jest --config test/jest.client.js --showConfig</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="3f94568c6ca242108a6b745f599e3ba5"><span offset-key="3f94568c6ca242108a6b745f599e3ba5:0">Outputting this we can see a </span>`project`<span offset-key="3f94568c6ca242108a6b745f599e3ba5:2"> configuration property, which will be applied specifically to that config, and a </span>`global`<span offset-key="3f94568c6ca242108a6b745f599e3ba5:4"> property, which will be applied to all configs.</span></span>

<span key="67eb23148dc9411b8878e9b63770f5fe"><span offset-key="67eb23148dc9411b8878e9b63770f5fe:0">To make it more clear which config is running which tests, we can add a </span>`displayName`<span offset-key="67eb23148dc9411b8878e9b63770f5fe:2"> property to each project config. When tests are run, they are output with their </span>`displayName`<span offset-key="67eb23148dc9411b8878e9b63770f5fe:4">s prepended.</span></span>

<span key="f9d2ad1e72464a5dac889a1b6fa7d5df"><span offset-key="f9d2ad1e72464a5dac889a1b6fa7d5df:0">In </span>`package.json`<span offset-key="f9d2ad1e72464a5dac889a1b6fa7d5df:2"> we no longer need to run separate scripts for our tests because Jest will be running multiple projects.</span></span>

## 

<span key="76ee2c14e4ad4f699019683d7fe740ee"><span offset-key="76ee2c14e4ad4f699019683d7fe740ee:0">22. Test specific projects in Jest Watch Mode with jest-watch-select-projects</span></span>

<span key="b59313017b984d3a9955f61d145c1e41"><span offset-key="b59313017b984d3a9955f61d145c1e41:0">Jest's </span>`projects`<span offset-key="b59313017b984d3a9955f61d145c1e41:2"> property allows us to run multiple configs at the same time, but if we only want to run tests for a single project we have to go back to the command line and run only that project.</span></span>

<span key="e9b8d718dd3c4cb1aa77360dea42ce31"><span offset-key="e9b8d718dd3c4cb1aa77360dea42ce31:0">Using the </span>`jest-watch-select-projects`<span offset-key="e9b8d718dd3c4cb1aa77360dea42ce31:2"> plugin we get a new </span>`P`<span offset-key="e9b8d718dd3c4cb1aa77360dea42ce31:4"> command in </span>`--watch`<span offset-key="e9b8d718dd3c4cb1aa77360dea42ce31:6"> mode that allows us to toggle projects, allowing us to run only the projects we're interested in.</span></span>

## 

<span key="9eb0146640ab4780a0b4541986123fa1"><span offset-key="9eb0146640ab4780a0b4541986123fa1:0">23. Run ESLint with Jest using jest-runner-eslint</span></span>

<span key="865aa701e80f4502bc779968f5ca26d9"><span offset-key="865aa701e80f4502bc779968f5ca26d9:0">Jest is not just a test runner, but a task running platform. It can be used to run linting on files, and even run tests on files of other languages. At the time of writing this there are test runners for both Go and Python.</span></span>

<span key="31e0e06abd6742bd912513dfc9c7c83c"><span offset-key="31e0e06abd6742bd912513dfc9c7c83c:0">To run tasks other than testing, we can create a new config which we add to the </span>`projects`<span offset-key="31e0e06abd6742bd912513dfc9c7c83c:2"> property in our Jest config.</span></span>

<span key="be48fa287a3446bd972bf3f2fea81c00"><span offset-key="be48fa287a3446bd972bf3f2fea81c00:0">In this config we specify a new runner, specifically </span>`jest-runner-eslint`<span offset-key="be48fa287a3446bd972bf3f2fea81c00:2">, to lint our files.</span></span>

## 

<span key="c47c60e4b2f04fb095fc0c078041d7d9"><span offset-key="c47c60e4b2f04fb095fc0c078041d7d9:0">24. Run only relevant Jest tests on git commit to avoid breakages</span></span>

<span key="6d6e0f30f2db4dc29ca967ffce667d67"><span offset-key="6d6e0f30f2db4dc29ca967ffce667d67:0">Jest has a </span>`--findRelatedTests`<span offset-key="6d6e0f30f2db4dc29ca967ffce667d67:2"> flag that will find all files related to a specific test. This can be used to speed up tests if only a few files have changed.</span></span>

<span key="12d013f522db4f4aa52da71fa629ddb5"><span offset-key="12d013f522db4f4aa52da71fa629ddb5:0">Knowing which files have changed takes time, but we can leverage </span>`husky`<span offset-key="12d013f522db4f4aa52da71fa629ddb5:2"> and </span>`lint-staged`<span offset-key="12d013f522db4f4aa52da71fa629ddb5:4"> to evaluate these files dynamically.</span></span>

<span key="a488999b6d6a48cd9f0ee5b99bd9e722">`husky`<span offset-key="a488999b6d6a48cd9f0ee5b99bd9e722:1"> allows us to configure git hooks, and </span>`lint-staged`<span offset-key="a488999b6d6a48cd9f0ee5b99bd9e722:3"> allows us to run commands on staged files. If those commands pass when a commit is attempted, the commit will be made, otherwise the commit will be prevented.</span></span>

<span key="6ba3fdea763246d19e2b46bae21333c2"><span offset-key="6ba3fdea763246d19e2b46bae21333c2:0">To configure this, we need a precommit hook. We add this as a script to </span>`package.json`<span offset-key="6ba3fdea763246d19e2b46bae21333c2:2">:</span></span>

1

<span key="94138e0f28ae449284d4a4bf865ffdb8"><span offset-key="94138e0f28ae449284d4a4bf865ffdb8:0">...</span></span>

2

<span key="b12ef4c4275846469bb6ffd0867f9d7f"><span offset-key="b12ef4c4275846469bb6ffd0867f9d7f:0">scripts</span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="b12ef4c4275846469bb6ffd0867f9d7f:1">:</span><span offset-key="b12ef4c4275846469bb6ffd0867f9d7f:2"> </span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="b12ef4c4275846469bb6ffd0867f9d7f:3">{</span></span>

3

<span key="8f55ce79a9c14362887c14088f1c9dfa"><span offset-key="8f55ce79a9c14362887c14088f1c9dfa:0"> ...</span></span>

4

<span key="85a0b2cdeeec41c8909eaa9d67cc1c7a"><span offset-key="85a0b2cdeeec41c8909eaa9d67cc1c7a:0"> </span><span class="r-qtrn9a" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="85a0b2cdeeec41c8909eaa9d67cc1c7a:1">"precommit"</span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="85a0b2cdeeec41c8909eaa9d67cc1c7a:2">:</span><span offset-key="85a0b2cdeeec41c8909eaa9d67cc1c7a:3"> </span><span class="r-qtrn9a" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="85a0b2cdeeec41c8909eaa9d67cc1c7a:4">"lint-staged"</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="85a0b2cdeeec41c8909eaa9d67cc1c7a:5">,</span></span>

5

<span key="3511ba6e01f549bdba21be419f5a7149"><span offset-key="3511ba6e01f549bdba21be419f5a7149:0"> ...</span></span>

6

<span key="132d185c2f754cf79925c0bbf1968005"><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="132d185c2f754cf79925c0bbf1968005:0">}</span></span>

7

<span key="3674332c57b04a15ab69d6dd1cef9cae"><span offset-key="3674332c57b04a15ab69d6dd1cef9cae:0">...</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="84182bef010944208b467b621ee91355"><span offset-key="84182bef010944208b467b621ee91355:0">We instruct </span>`husky`<span offset-key="84182bef010944208b467b621ee91355:2">, via our </span>`precommit`<span offset-key="84182bef010944208b467b621ee91355:4"> script, to run </span>`lint-staged`<span offset-key="84182bef010944208b467b621ee91355:6">.</span></span>

<span key="066243f14cc94a10aafe563b7188fd3b"><span offset-key="066243f14cc94a10aafe563b7188fd3b:0">In a </span>`lint-staged.config.js`<span offset-key="066243f14cc94a10aafe563b7188fd3b:2"> we can pass a list of files directly to Jest to have only those tests run before the commit is made:</span></span>

1

<span key="9ff5d4949f78414f8d0bc137c7615eab"><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="9ff5d4949f78414f8d0bc137c7615eab:0">...</span></span>

2

<span key="b3eddf1089a94094b07978d2c9b7915a"><span offset-key="b3eddf1089a94094b07978d2c9b7915a:0"> </span><span class="r-qtrn9a" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="b3eddf1089a94094b07978d2c9b7915a:1">'\*\*/\*.js'</span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="b3eddf1089a94094b07978d2c9b7915a:2">:</span><span offset-key="b3eddf1089a94094b07978d2c9b7915a:3"> </span><span class="r-qtrn9a" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="b3eddf1089a94094b07978d2c9b7915a:4">'jest --findRelatedTests'</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="b3eddf1089a94094b07978d2c9b7915a:5">,</span></span>

3

<span key="7899764729784e87b9bdd093cced3be0"><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="7899764729784e87b9bdd093cced3be0:0">...</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="fe76122abbd74811ab5cc4ba202946da"><span offset-key="fe76122abbd74811ab5cc4ba202946da:0">Jest will run tests on only the staged js files, as passed to it by </span>`lint-staged`<span offset-key="fe76122abbd74811ab5cc4ba202946da:2">, triggered by our </span>`precommit`<span offset-key="fe76122abbd74811ab5cc4ba202946da:4"> hook that is run by </span>`husky`<span offset-key="fe76122abbd74811ab5cc4ba202946da:6">.</span></span>

<a href="configure-jest-for-testing-javascript-applications.html#24.-run-only-relevant-jest-tests-on-git-commit-to-avoid-breakages" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-855088 r-dwliz8 r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-lqms97 r-dnmrzs r-iphfwy r-1guathk r-1h8ys4a r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr r-7xmw5f"></a>

24\. Run only relevant Jest tests on git commit to avoid breakages
